title: Futura alternatives
content:
Hello all,

I've noticed lately some great applications of Futura-like type:

President's choice packaging (it is replacing the over-used Trajan they previously had on their labels): [http://www.presidentschoice.ca/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014123436/http:/www.presidentschoice.ca/ "http://www.presidentschoice.ca/")

Sci-fi channel website: [http://www.scifi.com/onair/index.php?id=0](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014123436/http:/www.scifi.com/onair/index.php?id=0 "http://www.scifi.com/onair/index.php?id=0")

I was wondering what fonts are similar to this and have a similar feel. So far I've discovered:

-Futura  
-Century Gothic

what else is like those?
author: innovati

comments.content:
It would be great to have an updated opentype version of Futura, with all the alts and osf that Renner originally designed.  
In saying that Neutraface-2 is ridiculously useable (more for text than Futura I would say) and although a different beast, it is in similar vein (ish)

oh mili, I already have chalet, its 't' in the 1980 flavour is beyond belief!

and thanks all you guys, I really appreciate everything, I've looked over the links and I have a couple new wishes on my wish list!

Franz:

The Foundry has [Renner](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014123436/http:/www.foundrytypes.co.uk/foundry_architype_1/renner.html) and [Renner Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014123436/http:/www.foundrytypes.co.uk/foundry_architype_2/renner_bold.html) in its Architype library. Not sure whether those are OpenType.

Also check out [P22’s LTC Twentieth Century](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014123436/http:/www.p22.com/lanston/twentiethcen.html).

Moreover, there’s Gert Wiescher’s [Futura Classic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014123436/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/futura-classic/).
